title: Kapiton Pavlov
text: Kapiton Stepanovich Pavlov (1791 – 1 January 1852) was a Russian <a href="portrait">portrait</a> painter. A native of Reval (now <a href="Tallinn">Tallinn</a>), he was the son of a government official. He graduated from the Academy in <a href="St.%20Petersburg">St. Petersburg</a> in 1815, after which he went to <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>; there, he spent thirty years painting. From 1820 until 1829 he taught painting at the <a href="Gymnasium%20%28school%29">gymnasium</a> in <a href="Nezhin">Nezhin</a>. He also taught at <a href="Kiev%20University">Kiev University</a> from 1839 until 1841.
